org.alljoyn.about
Interface AboutService

All Superinterfaces:
ServiceCommon
All Known Implementing Classes:
AboutServiceImpl
public interface AboutService
extends ServiceCommon

An interface for both About client (consumer) and server (producer). An application may want to implement both, but still use one bus, so for convenience both functionalities are encapsulated here.

Parameters:

serviceAvailabilityListener - listener for connection loss
port - the peer's bound port of the About server

addAnnouncementHandler

void addAnnouncementHandler(AnnouncementHandler handler,
                            String[] interfaces)

Registers a handler to receive announcements.

The handler is only called if all the interfaces are implemented. For example, if the handler should be called if both "com.example.Audio" and "com.example.Video" are implemented then call

addAnnouncementHandler once:
 addAnnouncementHandler(handler, new String[] {"com.example.Audio", "com.example.Video"});

If the handler should be called if "com.example.Audio" or "com.example.Video" is implemented then call

addAnnouncementHandler multiple times:
 addAnnouncementHandler(handler, new String[] {"com.example.Audio"});
 addAnnouncementHandler(handler, new String[] {"com.example.Video"});

The interface name may be a prefix followed by a *. Using this, the example above could be written as:

 addAnnouncementHandler(handler, new String[] {"com.example.*"});

The handler will receive any announcement that implements an interface beginning with the "com.example." name.

If RegisterAnnounceHandler is called with lists of interfaces that overlap then multiple Announcements will occur.

For example given the following:
 addAnnouncementHandler(handler, new String[] {"com.example.Audio"});
 addAnnouncementHandler(handler, new String[] {"com.example.Audio", "com.example.Video"});

If a BusAttachment is found that implements both `com.example.Audio` and interface `com.example.Video` the announce handler will be called twice. Once for the first added AnnouncementHandler for `com.example.Audio` and again for the second added AnnouncementHandler that is looking for both audio and video interfaces.

If the same handler is used for for multiple interfaces then it is the handlers responsibility to parse through the reported interfaces to figure out what should be done in response to the Announce signal.

Note: specifying null for the interfaces parameter could have significant impact on network performance and should be avoided unless all announcements are needed.

Parameters:
handler - the AnnouncementHandler that will be receiving the announcement.
interfaces - an array of interfaces the remote service must implement to receive the announcement. If this parameter is null the handler will receive all announcements.
See Also:
AboutTransport.Announce(short, short, BusObjectDescription[], java.util.Map)

removeAnnouncementHandler

void removeAnnouncementHandler(AnnouncementHandler handler,
                               String[] interfaces)
Unregisters an announcement handler. When calling this the array of interfaces must match the array that was used when calling addAnnouncementHander.

Parameters:
handler - the AnnouncementHandler to remove. The array of interfaces must be the same as the array used when calling addAnnouncementHandler.
interfaces - an array of interfaces that were used when calling addAnnouncementHandler

startAboutServer

void startAboutServer(short port,
                      PropertyStore propertyStore,
                      BusAttachment m_bus)
                      throws Exception
Start server mode. The application creates the BusAttachment

Parameters:
port - the bound AllJoyn session port. The application binds the port, and the about server announces it.
propertyStore - a container of device/application properties.
m_bus - the AllJoyn bus attachment.
Throws:
Exception
See Also:
AboutKeys

stopAboutServer

void stopAboutServer()
                     throws Exception
Stop server mode.

Throws:
Exception

addObjectDescription

void addObjectDescription(String objPath,
                          String[] interfaces)
Add a BusObject and the BusInterfaces that it implements, to the server's Announcement.

Parameters:
objPath - the path of the BusObject
interfaces - the BusInterfaces that the BusObject implements.
See Also:
BusObjectDescription, AboutTransport.Announce(short, short, BusObjectDescription[], java.util.Map)

removeObjectDescription

void removeObjectDescription(String objPath,
                             String[] interfaces)
Remove the BusInterfaces that the given BusObject implements, from the server's Announcement

Parameters:
objPath - the path of the BusObject
interfaces - the interfaces to remove. Note: only the passed interfaces will be removed.
